snippet: Mixing young prisoners with adults is bad, and putting them in solitary confinement is even worse.
abstract: Editorial condemns the practice of confining young people to adult jails and prisons as both counterproductive and inhumane, arguing that it often results in psychological damage and recidivism; contends that the common state practice of holding juveniles in solitary confinement, often used as a protective strategy, is an even more destructive option.
lead_paragraph: Mixing young prisoners with adults is bad, and putting them in solitary confinement is even worse.
